title: How to Contact JD Vance (By Phone, Email, Social Media, or Letter)

steps.title: Vice President JD Vance's phone number is 202-224-2424.
steps.content: Vice President JD Vance's phone number is 202-224-2424. When you call his office, press 1 to leave a comment or a voicemail or 2 to speak directly to one of Vance's staff members. You most likely won't be allowed to speak to Vance directly. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Vice President JD Vance doesn't have an official email address.
steps.content: Vice President JD Vance doesn't have an official email address. Neither does the White House. You can, however, write a message and direct it to Vance using the official White House Contact form . Fill out the required fields with your first and last name, mailing address, phone number, and email address. Add your message to the Comments field and specify that you want it to go to Vice President JD Vance. There's no guarantee Vance will receive your message, but you can give it your best shot.

steps.title: Reach out to JD Vance on Facebook, X, and Instagram.
steps.content: Reach out to JD Vance on Facebook, X, and Instagram. On Facebook, Vance has two accounts: Vice President JD Vance and JD Vance . You can also find him on X at @VP and @JDVance , and on Instagram at @vp and @jdvance . Tag him in one of your posts on any of these social media platforms to get his attention, or send him a direct message (DM) on Facebook or Instagram. Keep in mind that Vance probably won't personally respond to your DMs. A member of his staff might send a reply, or they may ignore your message entirely.

steps.title: Vice President JD Vance's mailing address is the White House address.
steps.content: Vice President JD Vance's mailing address is the White House address. You can write a letter and send it directly to his office, where his staff will likely read it. If they think your message is important enough to pass on to Vance, he may read it himself. steps.title: JD Vance is a former Senator and the current Vice President of the US.
steps.content: JD Vance is a former Senator and the current Vice President of the US. He was born on August 2, 1984, in Middletown, OH, and grew up facing financial hardship and family strife. His father left his family when Vance was still young, and his mother was a drug addict. With the help of his grandmother, Mamaw, Vance overcame the difficulties of his youth. He enlisted in the Marine Corps and attended Yale Law School, where he met his future wife, Usha. In 2022, he was elected as senator of Ohio, and in 2024, President Donald J. Trump chose him as his running mate. [3] X Trustworthy Source The White House Official website for the Executive Branch of the U.S. government Go to source
